mdRecord.dcterms:title: Index map for sheets: extract of Military map of n.e. Virginia showing forts and roads
Defenses of Washington Plate 1
Defenses of Washington Plate 28
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: United States. War Department. Engineer Bureau [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Issued in J.G. Barnard's A report on the defenses of Washington to the Chief of Engineers, U.S. Army, 1871. [original]
Sections 2-12 are identified on the map. [original]
Washington, D.C. central to map, with Alexandria to south. [original]

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "1 mile to .9 inch. 1865" penciled on map, with latitude and longitude figures added in pencil. With this is housed an otherwise untitled map centering around Richmond, Defenses of Washington Plate 28. Penciled scale "1/2 inch to one mile." Both maps are linen-backed. [original]

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "1 mile to .9 inch. 1865" penciled on map, with latitude and longitude figures added in pencil. With this is housed an otherwise untitled map centering around Richmond, Defenses of Washington Plate 28. Penciled scale "1/2 inch to one mile." Both maps are linen-backed. [original]
